allGenericGroup.name: unchanged
allGenericGroup.description: Element unchanged in this phase or release.

allGenericGroup.name: updated
allGenericGroup.description: Element is modified or updated in this phase or release.

allGenericGroup.name: removed
allGenericGroup.description: Element being removed in this phase or release.

allGenericGroup.name: added
allGenericGroup.description: Element being added in this phase or release.

allGenericGroup.name: planned
allGenericGroup.description: Element is being planned for some future phase or release.

allGenericGroup.name: none
allGenericGroup.description: Either the security controls have not been specified or cannot be controlled.

allGenericGroup.name: trusted
allGenericGroup.description: Trusted security zone, all traffic and access is by known and trusted parties.

allGenericGroup.name: dmz
allGenericGroup.description: Direct access to un-trusted network, no sensitive data. Controlled access to trusted zone.

allGenericGroup.name: active
allGenericGroup.description: High availability replica actively handling workload.

allGenericGroup.name: passive
allGenericGroup.description: High availability replica not handling active workload.

architecturalDecisions.id: Copy of Data and AI Collect and Organize 001
architecturalDecisions.topic: Frequency of data collection should not be smaller than when an action can be taken.
architecturalDecisions.name: Copy of Frequency of Data Transfer
architecturalDecisions.problemStatement: Customers are often misled by competitors and sometime by IBM for getting insights from data on a frequency smaller than when an action can be taken.  This causes confusion and the outcome is not aligned with expectation.
architecturalDecisions.assumptions:
1. Customers are not aware of frequency and action
2. Customers are sold on collecting data and insights in real time even when they cannot take action in real time.
architecturalDecisions.motivation: Collect data that is needed and actionable and save on resources

alternatives.name: Collect data in realtime
alternatives.bestApplied: In critical situation like monitoring a customers critical health, security threats, crime prevention etc.
alternatives.contraindications: This alternative is not advisable in most situations when an action cannot be taken. For example : In situations like adjuster allocation for insurance companies, supply chain insights

alternatives.name: Frequency of data collection should be dependent on when action can be taken
alternatives.description: It may not be practically possible to take action on data collected more frequently. So the frequency of data collected should be determined by when an action can b e tyaken.
alternatives.contraindications: In situations that monitor health of an individual

architecturalDecisions.decision: Frequency of data collection should be dependent on when action can be taken
architecturalDecisions.justification: If action cannot be taken in a timely manner the data collection does not provide value.
architecturalDecisions.implications: Data collected does not provide value and increases the need for higher compute resources.
architecturalDecisions.derivedRequirements: Design architectures that can help in improving the time of actions
architecturalDecisions.relatedDecisions: Data Volume, Data Variety, Data Veracity

architecturalDecisions.id: Copy of Data and AI Collect and Organize 003
architecturalDecisions.name: Copy of Data Veracity
architecturalDecisions.problemStatement: Many a times the data collected may not be accurate, the quality of data determines the outcomes, Trustworthiness of data is an essential component.
architecturalDecisions.assumptions: Verification of sources of data not always known. Malfunctioning of IOT devices, Social media data is not always trustworthy.
architecturalDecisions.motivation: To achieve better insights from data.

alternatives.name: Governed and Trustworthy data
alternatives.description: Verified data sources improves data quality. Governance allows  only the information you want to ingest.
alternatives.bestApplied: In most situations for data driven decision making.
alternatives.contraindications: Trust in data and insights is lost

alternatives.name: Insights from data which is not governed
alternatives.description: Lack of data governance results in poor quality of data. Poor quality of data results in outcome that is not trustworthy. This shakes the confidence of business in decisions based on insights from poor quality of data.
alternatives.contraindications: Reliance on Subject Matter Experts, decision making based on past experience as opposed to guided by data. Time consuming business outcomes.

architecturalDecisions.justification: Better decision making. Trust in insights. Faster decision making guided by data. Better business outcome.
architecturalDecisions.implications: Governance has to be established in the selection of data
architecturalDecisions.relatedDecisions: Frequency of Data, Data Governance and Cataloging, Data Volume, Data Variety
